smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

smells.name: LongMethod
smells.description: One method should have one responsibility. Long methods tend to handle many things at once. Prefer smaller methods to make them easier to understand.

instances.message: The function onCreate is too long. The maximum length is 20.

smells.name: LongParameterList
smells.description: The more parameters a method has the more complex it is. Long parameter lists are often used to control complex algorithms and violate the Single Responsibility Principle. Prefer methods with short parameter lists.

smells.name: MethodOverloading
smells.description: Methods which are overloaded often might be harder to maintain. Furthermore, these methods are tightly coupled. Refactor these methods and try to use optional parameters.

smells.name: ComplexInterface
smells.description: An interface contains too many functions and properties. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. An interface should have one responsibility. Split up large interfaces into smaller ones that are easier to understand.

instances.message: The interface GeocachingApiEndpoint is too complex. Consider splitting it up.

smells.name: NotImplementedDeclaration
smells.description: The NotImplementedDeclaration should only be used when a method stub is necessary. This defers the development of the functionality of this function. smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message:
Parentheses in (dest.subSequence(0, dstart).toString() + filtered +
                    dest.subSequence(dend, dest.length)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: dest.subSequence(0, dstart).toString() + filtered +
                    dest.subSequence(dend, dest.length)

Parentheses in (dest.subSequence(0, dstart).toString() + filtered +
                    dest.subSequence(dend, dest.length)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: dest.subSequence(0, dstart).toString() + filtered +
                    dest.subSequence(dend, dest.length)
Parentheses in (accountManager.isPremium) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: accountManager.isPremium
Parentheses in (accountManager.isPremium) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: accountManager.isPremium
Parentheses in (params.key + response.size) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: params.key + response.size
Parentheses in (params.key + response.size) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: params.key + response.size

Parentheses in (dest.subSequence(0, dstart).toString() + filtered +
                    dest.subSequence(dend, dest.length)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: dest.subSequence(0, dstart).toString() + filtered +
                    dest.subSequence(dend, dest.length)

Parentheses in (dest.subSequence(0, dstart).toString() + filtered +
                    dest.subSequence(dend, dest.length)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: dest.subSequence(0, dstart).toString() + filtered +
                    dest.subSequence(dend, dest.length)
Parentheses in (if (t != null) " $t" else "") are unnecessary and can be replaced with: if (t != null) " $t" else ""

smells.name: UseDataClass
smells.description: Classes that do nothing but hold data should be replaced with a data class.

instances.message: The class DefaultPreferenceManager defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.
The class FilterPreferenceManager defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.
The class UpdateData defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.
The class WakeLockContainer defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.
The class ParseResult defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.
The class GuidToReferenceCodeResponse defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.

smells.name: UnusedPrivateMember
smells.description: Private member is unused.

instances.message: Private function writeObject is unused.
Private function readObject is unused.
Function parameter url is unused.
Function parameter t is unused.
Private property FIELD_TRACKING_NUMBER is unused.
Private function component6 is unused.
Private function component7 is unused.

smells.name: FunctionOnlyReturningConstant
smells.description: A function that only returns a constant is misleading. Consider declaring a constant instead

instances.message: isWebViewSafeUrl is returning a constant. Prefer declaring a constant instead.

smells.name: ThrowsCount
smells.description: Restrict the number of throw statements in methods.

instances.message: Too many throw statements in the function invoke. The maximum number of allowed throw statements is 2.

smells.name: PreferToOverPairSyntax
smells.description: Pair was created using the Pair constructor, using the to syntax is preferred.

instances.message: Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `oldPoint to newPoint`

smells.name: UnnecessaryAbstractClass
smells.description: An abstract class is unnecessary and can be refactored. An abstract class should have both abstract and concrete properties or functions. An abstract class without a concrete member can be refactored to an interface. An abstract class without an abstract member can be refactored to a concrete class.

instances.message: An abstract class without an abstract member can be refactored to a concrete class.
An abstract class without an abstract member can be refactored to a concrete class.
An abstract class without an abstract member can be refactored to a concrete class.

smells.name: ForbiddenVoid
smells.description: `Unit` should be used instead of `Void`.

instances.message: 'Void' should be replaced with 'Unit'.
'Void' should be replaced with 'Unit'.

smells.name: DataClassContainsFunctions
smells.description: Data classes should mainly be used to store data and should not have any extra functions. (Compiler will automatically generate equals, toString and hashCode functions)

instances.message: The data class Coordinates contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called distanceTo
The data class GeocachingAccount contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called refreshToken
The data class GeocachingAccount contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called updateUserInfo
The data class GeocachingAccount contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called isPremium
